item.title: SethScape Age-ing System [508]
item.dc:creator: @sethscape508 sethscape508
item.description:
@sethscape508 wrote:

Hello, sorry for not replying to any of you guys, but after reading most comments ive actually decided to redo my methods as creating a more stable age-ing system, there project is now 80% complete, theres still some things im having a bit trouble with heres a list of troubles:

Proper food = good health
Ages 110-120. (when it comes to this age it becomes glitched.)

thanks guys replys are welcome.

Read full topic

item.title: SethScape Age-ing System [508]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Nexus_, post:18, topic:393185”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=490356.msg3591148#msg3591148 date=1304644425]

Holy Jesus. It’s really simple, stop arguing with people who know what your talking about. Just create this and expand upon it:

public void ageDialogues(int i) {
      if (i == 0) {// new born, just registered
        c.sendMessage("Amg welcum 2 hour servarrhh!");
    }
      else if (i == 1) { //first whole day of playing
        c.sendMessage("Omg! Dud u r 1won yeer old!!!!111one1!!");
    }
}

Seriously, if you do something, make sure you do it the most convenient way and you also LEARN from it.

It would be better if had something like:

String age_messages[] = {"Amg welcum 2 hour servarrhh!", "Omg! Dud u r 1won yeer old!!!!111one1!!", "You're two now.", ""}; if(!age_messages[c.age].isEmpty()) c.sendMessage(age_messages[c.age]);

You would just fill up the array. The array index corresponds to your age. If you want a certain age (like 3) to not have a message, then you leave it blank in the array like I did above. It’s a lot more simple and efficient than a ton of if-elses.
[/quote]
I suppose, but I was giving an example. Anywho, you’d have to declare it, so it evens out.[/quote]

No. Just stop.

sendMessage("You are now " + (++age) + " years old.");

Read full topic

item.title: SethScape Age-ing System [508]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Diligo Deum, post:11, topic:393185”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=490356.msg3590928#msg3590928 date=1304631801]

i use booleans because its more stable, using intergers causing alot of lagg and improper functions.

How are booleans more stable than integers…How is assigning a ton of booleans less resource heavy than a single integer which will take up only one slot on your memory, versus however many booleans you declared…As a matter of fact, how does anything you just said above make a single shred of sense? =/

$100 to the first person who can prove the above is true, beyond a shred of doubt.

You didn’t just say that, did you? How exactly would you want to use an integer to assign itself to complex programs without erroring up or just looking plain stupid? Booleans are much easier to read than an integer which has over 49 arguments that return a different number each time.
[/quote]bool = 1 bit but making an arrayfull of them multiples this enormously, so having age up to 100- for say: 100 bits
one integer = 32 bits and can intake 2147m values plus is more easy to use[/quote]

Exactly. A boolean can only be true or false. If you use an int, you’d probably do something like

public void someMethod(int i) {
    if (i == 0) {// false
        doSomthing();
    }
    else if (i == 1) {
        doSomethingElse();
    }
}

What if the user enters any other number between 1 or 0? Nothing will happen. As you said, an integer can have approximately 4 billion values. What if you only need 2? You’re using 32 bits instead of 1.

Don’t be an idiot. If it’s a “true/false” type of value, use a boolean. It’s what they’re there for.

But, since he’s trying to use booleans for age, he should be flogged because age is a number.

Also: Would the age be based on the total time they’ve played/logged in, or days since they made the account?

Read full topic

public boolean Age() p.age = > 1; p.frames.sendMessage(p, you have aged a year, you are now " + p.age + " years old. "); p.frames.sendMessage(p, Remember to eat proper food to grow big and strong! "); } }

item.title: SethScape Age-ing System [508]
item.dc:creator: @sethscape508 sethscape508
item.description:
@sethscape508 wrote:

hello fellow rspsidians, im here to explain to you about an age-ing system im currently developing.

HOW IT WORKS:

the system uses booleans and static’s and timer’s to progress runescape real - time age-ing.

WHAT IT DOES:

In SethScape you create an account as soon as you log in it will create your profile with an age of 1 years old, and starts a real - time runescape environment. real - time meaning its counting the minutes you play to subsequently add to your age. 1 day is 1 year in SethScape . as you get older you become stronger, at 18 you will be able to purchase beer, high requirement weapons, join the army and increased strength and wisdom. as you get older to mid 30 - 50s your hair starts to get whiter but depending on how you live and what you eat, you can keep young looking. from 60 - 80 is the time you should start considering retirement, in relaxing sitting down and drinking good ol’ ginger i mean your old at this point decreased stability, sleepier , less strength and running requisitees. and sooner or later death… the average life for a sethscape player is 80 years old but as i mentioned it depends how you live and what you eat on sethscape, you will be able to live longer. the oldest age achievable so far is 120 years old. those who are at 120 years old are the finest and wisest but weakest players out there. you must praise your elders in remorse for they are old . when you are 120 years old you will be a god amongst men. Now if you die you will be bound to the 4th dimension to of which you are with other dead sethscapians. you will have to spend a couple of years depending on how well you do and maybe if your lucky you can get a ticket out of the 4th dimension back to the reality of sethscape.

PROGRESS: 60% Complete

NOTES: got the base finished just need to finish the extras and add some more booleans to the ages 50 - 120

Comments are appreciated as ive spent a couple months already developing this i will add pictures soon.

HERES A CODE THAT TELLS YOU WHEN YOU’VE AGED.

public boolean Age()
p.age = > 1;
p.frames.sendMessage(p, " you have aged a year, you are now " + p.age + " years old. ");
p.frames.sendMessage(p, " Remember to eat proper food to grow big and strong! ");
}
}

The reason i didnt use intergers is because i found it creates improper functions, as booleans creates a more stable aging process.

Read full topic
